Home → Parents, carers and children → New in and children's reading ideas

New in and children's reading ideas

Reviews, suggestions and lists of new books for children aged 0-11. We have recommendations for readers aged 11+ in our Young Adult section.

Celebrate Roald Dahl Day with our ten most popular titles

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 13, 2017

It's Roald Dahl Day. To celebrate, we've put together a list of the top ten most-issued Roald Dahl books in our libraries.

Check out a beautiful book from the 2017 Klaus Flugge Prize shortlist

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 13, 2017

The Klaus Flugge Prize recognises promising and exciting newcomers to children's picture book illustration.

Find something great to read with the Tom Fletcher Book Club

Written by Sophie Green · Published Sep 11, 2017

WHSmith have launched the Tom Fletcher Book Club to get children excited about reading with brilliant books. Why not reserve or pick up one of their highly-recommended titles?

New children's books for September 2017

Written by Sophie Green · Published Aug 30, 2017

We've got a bumper crop of exciting new children's books this month

Check out some of our favourite detective stories for children

Written by Sophie Green · Published Aug 14, 2017

Is helping the Animal Agents solve the case for this year's Summer Reading Challenge giving your child a taste for mystery? Or perhaps they're wondering what book to read next to progress with the Challenge? We've made a list of our favourite detective books for children.

New children's books for August 2017

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Jul 31, 2017

Introduce your children to characters and stories old and new with our latest titles

Mark Suffolk Dog Day with some of our favourite doggy children's books

Written by Alice Violett · Published Jul 28, 2017

It's Suffolk Dog Day on Sunday 30 July. Why not pick up some dog-related titles to share with your children?

There is a Tribe of Kids by Lane Smith

Written by Sophie Green · Published Jul 20, 2017

There is a Tribe of Kids, by Lane Smith, won the 2017 Greenaway Medal. Stock librarian Sophie gives her verdict.

Salt to the Sea by Ruta Sepetys

Written by Ann Halliday · Published Jul 19, 2017

Salt to the Sea, by Ruta Sepetys, won the 2017 Carnegie Medal. Library and information advisor Ann gives her verdict.

Check out the shortlist for the 2017 CLiPPA

Written by Sophie Green · Published Jul 14, 2017

Moon Juice, by Kate Wakeling, has just won the 2017 CLiPPA (Centre for Literacy in Primary Poetry Award). Why not pick up some books from the shortlist?

More Children's books

  • Stradbroke Library choose: Rabbit's Nap, by Julia Donaldson & Axel Scheffler
  • Southwold Library choose: Oi Frog!, by Kes Gray & Jim Field
  • Beccles Library choose: The Amber Spyglass, by Philip Pullman
  • New children's books for May 2019
  • Borrow a brilliant children's poetry book from the 2019 CLiPPA shortlist
  • Stowmarket Library choose: Stig of the Dump, by Clive King & Edward Ardizzone
  • Kedington Library choose: The Paper Dolls, by Julia Donaldson & Rebecca Cobb
  • Saxmundham Library choose: Inkheart, by Cornelia Funke
  • Lakenheath Library choose: The Night Before Christmas, by Clement Clarke Moore, Zdenko Basic & Manuel Šumberac
  • Wickham Market Library choose: The Tiger Who Came to Tea, by Judith Kerr
